channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 22/11/25
item.content:encoded:
I certainly wasn’t expecting to have been raining in Las Vegas when I belatedly got up and turned on the replay of the Formula 1 qualifying. I’m not silly enough to get up at 4AM for this time-shifted race, so enjoyed the mixed up conditions with daylight emerging, and now I’m rather looking forward to doing the same for the race tomorrow!

In the News This Week

Microsoft had an Xbox Partner Preview stream this week, which dished out a bunch of trailers and announcements to sink our teeth into.

  • Vampire Crawlers is a Vampire Survivors deckbuilding dungeon crawler coming out next year
  • Reanimal picks the most horrifying date possible for its February 2026 launch
  • Tales of Berseria Remastered announced, releases February 27th
  • Total Chaos is out now, the Doom mod rebuilt as a standalone survival horror
  • Ghost of Yōtei New Game Plus update arrives next week
  • Paradox and Colossal Order split – Cities: Skylines 2 development moves to Iceflake Studios
  • Beyond These Stars early access delayed to 2026
  • Nintendo shares first The Legend of Zelda live-action film still images
  • Bungie finally admit they messed up Destiny 2 and are going to make changes
  • F1 26 is a DLC – the next full F1 game will be in 2027
  • Sony gets Black Friday underway with £90 off a PS5

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s start off with the reviews, as per usual.

  • Umami – PC – 9/10
  • Anno 117: Pax Romana – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater – Fox Hunt – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road – PC – 8/10
  • Tomb Raider Definitive Edition – NSW2, NSW – 8/10
  • Kirby Air Riders – NSW2 – 7/10

We also had a couple hardware reviews for the Gioteck WX5+ controller and Corsair SABRE v2 Pro mouse.

Beyond that, Nic had the chance to sit down with Sohei Niikawa to talk Etrange Overlord and life after the board room.

Jason dove into the early access release of Moonlighter 2 for the first time, which is handling a jump across to 3D visuals and deeper combat. I went hands on with the puppet-tastic Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, which is shaping up really nicely, and Team Ninja’s latest soulslike in the form of Nioh 3. It’s going broader, and it has ninjas in it now!

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Nioh 3, Ghost of Yotei & Monsters Are Coming!

Trailer Park

Raji: Kaliyuga announced, set six years after Raji: An Ancient Epic.

See a spectacular boss battle from Tides of Annihilation

Zoopunk is a sensational animal action adventure from the makers of FIST: Forged in Shadow Torch

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman started playing Observation, and said it “feels like playing 2001 A Space Odyssey, but you take on the role of HAL”

That’s the round up for this week’s round up. Enjoy the weekend, and we’ll catch you for more gaming shenanigans next week!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/22/something-for-the-weekend-22-11-25/

item.title: Fallout 4 November patch detailed, console players need to take action for mods
item.content:encoded:
Bethesda has revealed the details for the Fallout 4 November patch, which adds a brand new Varmint Rifle and fixes for various issues causing crashes. However, the November patch will not bring the mod storage expansion for consoles as planned. But, console players need to be aware that when this update is released in December it will reset the mod load order, so action needs to be taken.

If you are playing Fallout 4 on consoles and using mods, these are the steps to take to make sure your load order is not impacted.

  1. Navigate to the Creations Menu and select the Load Order Menu by selecting the option listed at the bottom of the screen.
  2. At the bottom of the Load Order Menu screen, select “Load Order Archive.”
  3. Select “Save Load Order to Bethesda.net.”
  4. Select “Yes” to confirm.
  5. You should receive a message confirming the current load order has been saved to Bethesda.net
  6. Exit the menu and allow the game to reload your data files. The game will confirm your load order has changed, indicating the process is complete!

And here are the Fallout 4 November patch notes:

Crash and Stability Fixes 

  • Fixed crash when starting a new game with Creations installed on PS4. 
  • Fixed crash when quitting after exiting an interior with Pip-Boy open (PS4/PS5). 
  • Guest/local users can no longer access the Creations menu, which resulted in an inoperable state 
  • Addressed rare crashes when choosing to use the save data load order, especially when loading saves with missing Creations. 
  • Fixed a crash that could occur when selecting ‘Purchase Credits’ on PC 
  • Fixed a crash when selecting “Download all owned Creation Club Creations” 

 Save/Load & Profile 

  • Exit saves are now correctly created when exiting to the main menu 
  • Fixed infinite loading when downloading missing Creation Club content from a save made on a different platform. 
  • Switching Xbox user profiles no longer causes softlocks or loss of controls. 
  • Fixed an issue where loading a save file with different creations enabled did not prompt a load order warning 
  • Downloading a creation and disabling it immediately, will no longer cause content that relies on it to become permanently disabled 

UI & User Experience 

  • Performance improvements in the Creations menu across platforms. 
  • Fixed softlocking when entering/exiting the Creations menu repeatedly. 
  • Fixed infinite loading/hang when loading a save file that requires creations.  
  • Bundle prices now update immediately after purchasing individual items in the bundle. 
  • Bundles now show correct file sizes for included creations. 
  • Localization improvements. 
  • In-game Creations menu now respects the load order set by the player, not alphabetical order. 
  • Players can now like/unlike creations in the Load Order menu as intended. 
  • Guest/local users can no longer access the Creations menu; option is now greyed out as on PS4. 
  • Downloaded Creations will now remain visible in your Load Order after deletion from BethesdaNet

Source: Bethesda/Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/22/fallout-4-november-patch-detailed-console-players-need-to-take-action-for-mods/
